Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Fleming \Flem"ing\, n. A native or inhabitant of Flanders. [1913 Webster]

Fleming n 1: British writer famous for writing spy novels about secret agent James Bond (1908-1964) [syn: {Ian Fleming}, {Ian Lancaster Fleming}] 2: English bacteriologist who discovered penicillin (1881-1955) [syn: {Alexander Fleming}, {Sir Alexander Fleming}] 3: a native of Flanders or a Flemish-speaking Belgian
